author: daneofurexistence

text:
I've had this song on the mind recently... I honestly loved playing this game growing up. It's probably why Aladdin is one of my favorite movies ever, and my favorite Disney movie. The soundtrack is just a complete masterpiece. I've seen and played the SNES one once, and it was pretty fun. But the Genesis version was far more enjoyable in my opinion. 

Ohh, and I'm surprised I managed to get passed this level a few times as a kid, it was absolute hell to go through. Sultan'sPalaceIsWhere I died.

author: Engie's Video Game Music Dispenser

text: Eh, to each his own I guess. I love the animation and level structure of the Genesis but there were some things the SNES version had that the Genesis was deprived of: the 'whole new world' level, an actual ending, and bosses that made sense 'Gazeem...seriously?' The whole sword argument I'll never understand either. It felt sloppy and never suited the character of Aladdin. He uses the sword in the movie for 5 minutes. As for Arab Rock..PC version is more intense.
author: Wardog 1991

text: I know quite a few people who prefer the SNES version, but looking at it now, it does seem like the Genesis version is widely considered to be the best.

text: I enjoyed the SNES version, but I thought it didn't hold a candle to the Genesis version. The animation was better, you actually wielded a sword and it had this music. It's funny too, at the time Capcom was pretty much the best when it came to creating licensed games (they made the SNES version), but I have to side with Virgin for this one.
